attributes.action: allow petitions on this site that permit the British public to express a vote of no-confidence in the government and for that to be indicative of whether a General Election should be called within the next 12 months.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Anyone visiting this site is able to look at the refused petitions, many of which are calling for the resignation of Gordon Brown and/or the calling of a General Election.  Why are these petitions being refused?  Presumably because the current government wishes to remain in power.  If, as Gordon Brown says, he wishes to develop an open government that listens to the electorate, he should also allow those who wish to see a change of government register their petitions to see whether or not there is a general mood for change among the population of the United Kingdom.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
